Delivering high-quality software is a necessity and that’s why Azure Test Plans has introduced the all-new [Test Run Hub](https://aka.ms/AzureDevOps/TestRun), an enabler for teams who want to take control of their testing process and drive continuous improvement.

[![test runs landing page image](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAASwAAACGAQMAAABdQyUKAAAAA1BMVEXW1taWrGEgAAAACXBIWXMAAA7EAAAOxAGVKw4bAAAAHElEQVRYhe3BMQEAAADCoPVPbQhfoAAAAAAAXgMUagABFxYuIQAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2025/07/test-runs-landing-page-scaled.png)

## What Makes the Test Run Hub a Must-Have?

The Test Run Hub is designed to help teams track test progress, analyze results, and maintain quality across every development cycle. Whether you’re running manual or automated tests, the new test run hub brings clarity and efficiency to your quality assurance workflow.

## Key Benefits

*Real-Time Visibility:* Instantly monitor test progress and quality trends, so you can spot regressions or failures before they impact your release.

*Comprehensive Analytics:* Dive into historical test data to audit, analyze, and continuously improve your testing strategy.

*Seamless end to end user flow:* Test runs are created automatically from test plans or automated test pipelines, capturing every detail of an execution’s outcomes.

## Effortless Test Run Management

Accessing and managing your test runs has never been easier:

Navigate to the Test Plans section in your Azure DevOps project and select “Runs” under the Test Plans section.

Use powerful filters—timeline, run type, test run ID, and more—to find exactly what you need.

Customize your view with persistent search and column settings, ensuring your dashboard always fits your workflow.

## Actionable Insights at Your Fingertips

Each test run comes with a built-in analytics dashboard, breaking down results by outcome, priority, configuration, failure type, and resolution. Do you want to focus on a specific area? Just click a dashboard tile to filter and drill down for deeper insights.

[![run analytics image](data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAASwAAACvAQMAAAB94HH0AAAAA1BMVEXW1taWrGEgAAAACXBIWXMAAA7EAAAOxAGVKw4bAAAAHUlEQVRYhe3BMQEAAADCoPVPbQwfoAAAAAAAAOBgGqkAAWlbAQIAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/devops/wp-content/uploads/sites/6/2025/07/run-analytics-scaled.png)

## Attachments, Work Items, and Collaboration

Add screenshots, logs, and other artifacts directly to your test runs for richer context and deep dive analysis.

Link test results to Azure DevOps work items, like bugs or tasks, so nothing falls through the cracks.

Collaborate with your team using run-level comments (markdown supported!) and detailed dedicated analysis fields.

## Few More Improvements Highlights

**Filtering Enhancements**

- Filter test runs by the pipeline where the test was executed.
- User-specific filter selections in the Test Run Hub are now saved automatically.
- Filter test results by area path for more targeted analysis.

**Attachment Support**

- Expanded preview capabilities for a wide range of attachment file types.
- Ability to delete attachments from test runs.

**Markdown Support for Comments**

- Rich markdown controls now available for enhanced comment formatting.

## Programmatic Power for Advanced Teams

Do you need more configurations? The Test Run Hub supports programmatic management via the [Azure DevOps REST API](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/azure/devops/test/runs?view=azure-devops-rest-7.1). Extend dropdowns, automate reporting, and integrate with your existing toolchain for an even more tailored experience.

## Ready to elevate your QA process?

The new Test Run Hub in Azure DevOps Test Plans is automatically gradually enabled for all organizations. Dive today and experience a smarter, more efficient way to manage your test runs. Ship with confidence!
